intro: Periomphale balansae, commonly known as the Balansae's periomphale, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. Native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
